page.title: 04The Lock at Marlow
page.content: The original lock was built in{Marlow in 1777 where the footbridge is now. In 1812 the lock was improved and made with concrete. The new lock can hold 685 000 litres (4.5 metres deep) when low. It can hold 1 370 000 litres (9 metres deep) when full. A boat would normally have to wait one to one and a half hours to go through the lock on a really busy day. On average one person falls in every week. Most of them try to jump the 1.5 metres with only half a metre of rope! When we asked the lockkeeper about the old mill that used to be there he said that it was disused in 1945 and pulled down in 1968. He doesn't like the new houses that have been built there. He well remembers the day in 1977 when as part of her Jubilee Celebrations {the Queen came through the lock.
